column5: Got the last one paid for and decided two would be better than one.  So I asked her what she wanted and she said she didn't care,  as long as it matched her outfit and boots.  Red and black indeed!!!
Must only be able to get them plaid boots in Sturgeon Falls....  Good for her! It's about time you stopped making her walk behind yours to camp..
Wallmart specials!! and shes getting sick of watching the dog get to ride in.. poor old thing!
ha ha ha
Very nice!
monique better not read this
nice ride !!
now when your at the camp you can send her to the store for milk    beer.....  nice move
Smart choice , reliable trail machine
Un tres beau quatre-roue Mme Quesnel...  enjoy.  RFS
Awesome! Did you look at other brands, Yammy, Suzuki, CanAm? What made you pick Honda? I am looking for a quad and can't decide between brands. Thx Ted

I have a 2005 version of that bike, it has been.. well awesome, never a problem, and is a pleasure to ride, performing beyond my expectations. Still runs like it did when I first bought it.  Snow plow in the winter, workhorse in the summer.  This bike is identical, except for the power steering which is handy for Monique.  For me, with the first one being such a quality bike there was no other option.
nice choice, honda makes a good quality bike

Can't go wrong with a Honda. My f-in-law had a Yammie 650 quad and it was awesome to blast around on the logging and mining roads out Kenora way. ENJOY!!! When I was a kid I had a Honday XR100 that I kicked the snot out of and it never quit. Jeez, I miss riding.........Now to convince the missus that I need a Harley.....
Sweet!!!  Nice boots, I have the same pair in leopard print  Joey
sweet ride congrats
Nice, even has a seat on the back for moi.
I hope your talking about the bike....
The boots too!!! WOOOOOHOOOOOOO! I only saw the other leopard print stuff!
Maybe
